## **Eigen Values and Statistical Distance**

---

```{r s1, comment=NA, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE, fig.width=8, fig.height=5}

## Generate some data
library(mvtnorm)

mu = rep(10, 6)
cov = matrix(nrow = 6, byrow = TRUE,
  c(1, 0, 1, 0, 1, 1,
    0, 2, 1, 2, 1, 1,
    1, 1, 2, 1, 1, 0,
    0, 2, 1, 3, 2, 1,
    1, 1, 1, 2, 4, 1,
    1, 1, 0, 1, 1, 10)
  )

set.seed(1000)
X = rmvnorm(100, mu, cov)

## How do the data correlate?
cor(X)
pairs(X)

## Principal Components
summary(X)

## Since all of the variables are roughly the same scale we do not need to standardize the data
(pr = prcomp(X))

## Principal components rotation matrix is actually the same as th eigen vectors
sqrt(eigen(cov)$values)

```
